page.title: 02 Harpole Church Farm
page.content: This farm, of 250 acres has been in the family for some time & is concerned with animal production. There are 150 Friesian cattle & 1 Hereford bull;5 Landrace sows & 1 boar; 330 Suffolk Crossbred sheep;1 Suffolk Wiltshire Horn ram & 510 lambs.There are two working sheepdogs. Milk is collected twice daily by the Milk Marketing Board. Some calves are kept but most are sold at three weeks old.A bull can fetch 900 pounds & a cow 400 pounds. Lambs are sold between May & December in Northampton for 55 pounds.The Wool Board pay 3 pounds per fleece. The sows are worth about 60 pounds and have two litters per year. The farmer hopes to increase his hay production of 10,000 bales. The machinery consists of 5 tractors, bale turner and a muck spreader.
